name: places/ChIJ96L7oIX3wokR7CgWnXiptIk
formattedAddress: 1909 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10032, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1909 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10032, USA

originalText.text:
Terrible management I've seen, don't know how the management manage the business. Everything is sick. No hot water and heat in the winter, can you imagine how cold it is? my little baby is sick because of this. I pay for the rent on time every month, and I can't get what I deserve? It doesn't make any sense. Is that hard to fix the boiler? You should hire someone more professional.

The front door of the building is broken. I've seen someone that is not living in this building just get into the building, I feel unsafe. The elevator is broken all the time.

The announcement said water will be shut off from 8am to 4pm. I totally understand it. However, they shut the water off around 4:30pm. what time zone are you in? Looks like you are not in eastern time zone. I called management office from 6pm, no one fixed it. It is 11:30pm, still no water at all. Is any one available to fix emergency issue? It is so ridiculous.

You should give the property back to NYCHA.

originalText.text:
Good afternoon all,

On the management’s website it says: An environment where everyone feels welcome  However, recently this has not been the case. Have this been asked to the Actual TENANTS Residing at 1909 Amsterdam ave? FARIA MANAGEMENT claims their property management teams has pride in delivering exceptional property management services to our clients. We believe that our team's dedication, passion, and expertise are the driving forces behind our success.

Ok let see the actual facts. 1909 amsterdam ave (Audubon Houses) has been undergoing water issues since Sunday April 30th 2023 making it today the 6th day Floors without water at all and some lower floor with very low water pressure. Over 1 month with no heat and when we had water no hot water at all.
But the worst part is the notice posted in the building: NO WATER UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.

Friendly Reminder: Thanks to the tenants residing at 1909 amsterdam ave a new job source was created therefore I believe we should all be treated with dignity and respect and RULES SHOULD APPLY TO EVERYONE especially when these tenants have been here for years.

As per Tifanny Wright property manager, she asked us to abandon  our parking spaces which some of us have had for many years and paying for its use. A 4 day notice to leave the premises without giving us time to make arrangements. THIS PARKING IS FOR THE RESIDENTS BUT INSTEAD IS being USED ONLY AND EXCLUSIVELY  FOR FARIA MANAGEMENT EMPLOYEES.

THATS IS COMPLETELY UNFAIR TO THE TENANTS WHO ARE THE ONES RESIDING at 1909 Amsterdam ave paying rent FOR FARIA MANAGEMENT  to pay their EMPLOYEES we deserve RESPECT.

The elevators are breaking down every month and as an alternative have to use  the stairs. There are 20 floors and it is unrealistic to ask people to use the stairs when people may have medical conditions, small children, and/or elderly tenants. As an example, I live in the 18th floor and last month (4/4 to 4/6) I had to walk up and down these stairs with a 18 month baby because I had to make it to work. This is unjust. Please review the pictures of the stairs we have to use, it is unsanitary and unsafe.

Please take some time to ask tenants about the treatment by FARIA MANAGEMENT STAFF. How we were threatened to have our cars towed without the management even having a contract with any towing company or having the appropriate signs displayed in all entry access.

It was also brought up that Ms Wright was upset because some tenants got city officials involved when she decided to close the first lot and that is why she closed the second one as well as per one of her staff.

I have included some city officials as they have provided their email address when reached out by several tenants. We have rights as tenants that we would like to be considered.

These are the degrading conditions we are living at 1909 Amsterdam ave not to mention how rude most of the staff is to us. We did not ask for this transition the least that can be done is give us some peace not the other way around.

I am willing to attend a meditation session with management to advocate for myself and some of my fellow neighbors. Tenants have asked for information from FARIA MANAGEMENT however we are still without answers. We have been denied the name and numbers for upper management in the company but to no avail. We, the tenants would like to set a meeting date and time in the immediate future and within a timely manner in order to be heard and to resolve our issues and receive answers. Please feel free to contact me for further discussions

Thank you,

originalText.text: Faria Management is by far the worst company of any kind I have ever encountered. Right now the water in my bathroom is off since this morning. I could go with how these people continue to ruin my life but I'm running out of space

text.text: Faria Management is by far the worst company of any kind I have ever encountered. Right now the water in my bathroom is off since this morning. I could go with how these people continue to ruin my life but I'm running out of space

originalText.text: Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. They answered all my questions and handled my repair request quickly.

text.text: Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. They answered all my questions and handled my repair request quickly.

originalText.text: Sooo happy with the renovation being completed. This new management is taking care of all the issues NYCHA neglected.
